newsitem.title: USA: Delta implements time-definite product line.
newsitem.headline: Delta implements time-definite product line.

text.p: Delta Air Cargo said it has implemented its new domestic product line emphasizing time definite status for all shipments.
From September 1, it also has been booking all shipments on its new Cargo Booking and Management System developed in conjunction with Unisys Corp.
The carrier's four domestic cargo products are as follows
DASH, a premium domestic flight-specific, airport-to-airport service with 30 minute drop-off and recovery for packages with dimensions of less than 90 inches and a maximum weight of 70 pounds.

Priority First Freight, a premium domestic, flight-specific service for larger freight, both containerized or bulk. Shipments may be tendered up to 90 minutes before departure and are available for pickup 120 minutes after flight.

Priority Second Day, a domestic second-day product for general freight. Shipments tendered by midnight will be available for pickup by 8 am on the second day. It is offered on all direct and one-stop city pairing in Delta's network.

Priority Third Day, available across the Delta system, it includes all markets requiring more than one connection, A shipment tendered by midnight on Monday will be available for pickup by noon on Thursday.

Delta also said that international freight will be treated as Priority First Freight for the domestic portion of any multi-leg journey, either connecting from or to an international flight., --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
